intro: Haylockia cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba haylockia, is a flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh Andean climate. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Haylockia cochabambensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
